alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Lincoln; Oklahoma; Pottawatomie (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 7:31PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Oklahoma, southwestern Lincoln, northeastern Cleveland and northwestern Pottawatomie Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 731 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southeastern Oklahoma City, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southeastern Oklahoma City, Norman, Midwest City, Choctaw, Noble, Harrah, McLoud, Nicoma Park, Pink, Etowah, Stella, Stanley Draper Lake, Newalla, Lake Thunderbird, Tinker Air Force Base, and Little Axe. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 159 and 178. Interstate 240 between mile markers 11 and 16. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
